intro: Gamocarpha gilliesii, commonly known as the New Zealand mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often growing on rocky slopes and in open grasslands. Gamocarpha gilliesii is adapted to harsh climatic conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
